result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Defense counsel waives the Spanish interpreter for today's Court date.  Defense counsel was recently appointed on this case and requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza in court.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. 
OFF THE RECORD:  Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Brenda Batholomew appeared to interpreter new court date with defendant.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Court will reschedule case to status of counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  State's witness appeared by zoom.  The public defenders office has not appointed counsel and this case.  Court finds GOOD CAUSE to toll time limits for preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court or in the alternative status. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JAR (dob 12/1/1981)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guadalupe Fidel Cruz-Garza appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
